data.name: Consultant - Full stack developer, Acensi Canada
data.description: Full stack developer as a consultant for Acensi Canada. My mission was at Desjardins, working as a backend engineer.

data.name: Backend developer, Desjardins
data.description: Backend developer at Desjardins, working as a consultant for Acensi Canada. I worked on the modernisation of the “Prise de Rendez Vous” service, allowing clients or employees to make an appointment with an advisor
details: Worked on a batch service extracting appointment data in order to make some intel for the financial service
Worked on the APIs creating the appointments
Technologies used: Java, SpringBoot Framework, Splunk

data.name: Full stack developer, Attraqt
data.description: Full Stack developer at Attraqt, working on an AI powered recommendation service for E-commerce merchants on both the algorithms, the API microservices and the front
details: Created an internal UI for the customer success managers to onboard their customer easily
Worked on catalogue daily import jobs, with a focus on performance and speed
Worked on an API sorting products on their colour proximity with another one
Technologies used: Kotlin, Kotlin coroutines, ReactJs, Protobuf, Terraform, Github Actions

data.name: Enterprise Architect, Adeo
data.description: Enterprise architect in apprenticeship for Leroy Merlin France’s marketplace (3,000 vendors and 300,000 references).
details: Work on the Information Service to harmonise the installation services (installation of a water heater for example) for the marketplace in Italy, to have the same processes than France’s marketplace
Conception and creation of an internal repository for the architecture team
Softwares and technologies used : Draw.io, Miro, GSuite Tools, ExpressJs, ReactJs, GCP

data.name: Full stack developer, Worldline
data.description: Full stack developer as intern at the end of my Bachelor, working on a remote payment system.
details: Redesign of login pages and a transaction portal
Technologies used : Java, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Angular

data.linkName: See the entire list of my projects

data.description: The different languages I speak. As you may see, I love learning new languages, not just in IT.

content.title: English
content.body2: When I was little, I used to go to London a lot. I live in Cana, so I also have the opportunity to practice daily. I also passed the TOEIC with a score of 950 over 990.

content.title: Spanish
content.body2: I have a good understanding of written Spanish. I read El País weekly in 2019 to improve and be more aware of the country's political and economic situation. I also spoke Spanish during the entire month of August 2021, doing the Camino de Santiago.

content.title: Korean
content.body2: I started learning Korean during my last year at high school, in 2017. The Korean alphabet and grammar are quite easy to understand, but it is still hard to understand Koreans when they are talking! However, I could make myself quite understood when I went to (South) Korea for a month in September 2022.

content.title: Italian, Dutch, German
content.body2: Interest in these languages, but I don't have much time and opportunity to practice, sadly.

data.description: Some of the different languages I code in.

content.title: Java
content.body2: I really like Java because it's well conceived and it's quite easy to model anything with this language. I did a lot with this language, from coding small plugins with an interface to creating backends with the Spring-Boot framework.

content.title: Python
content.body2: A great language to begin with. I did my first projects with this language and it's, from my point of view, a really powerful and interesting language, easy to set up and scale with.

content.title: Kotlin
content.body2: Augmented Java is great ! Very useful to create mobile applications, I also enjoyed doing some Spring-Boot REST backends with this language.

content.title: React (and a bit of Redux)
content.body2: I always loved JavaScript but I really enjoy the React framework, with Redux and Material UI, in order to make beautiful frontends in the blink of an eye. Components reusability and single page architecture bring a great flow to web applications.

data.name: Improvisational theatre and theatre
data.description: Practice of improvisational theatre during 15 years and theatre during 10 years
